events.description: Distant cars pass on dark street, headlights glinting off diner windows
Nighttime street scene with lit diner, parked car, tree in corner, streetlights glowing
Fingerpicked guitar and soft drums play as man begins strumming in diner
events.audio_description: Fingerpicked guitar, soft drums, reflective mood

events.description: Man speaks, eyes on guitar, fingers forming chords while explaining technique
Man and girl seated with acoustic guitars, man demonstrating riff, girl watching
Fingerpicked guitar and soft drums continue, camera focused on musicians
events.audio_description: Fingerpicked guitar, soft drums, reflective mood

events.description: Man speaks, hand gesturing near guitar neck, explaining chord transition
Man speaks, looking at girl, explaining bridge change with slight nod
Girl turns head toward man, eyes wide, body leaning forward in response
Girl speaks, head tilted, voice light, responding to man’s instruction

segments.text: Um, so it's, it's just G and C really, but there's a little riff that, you know, and then there's a, there's a G sus.
I don't have to do that, right?
No, you just play the G and the C. There's a, there's a, there's a C minor in the bridge, you know, I'll like nod at E or something when that happens.
The voice that whispers in our head Suggestin' we just stay in bed Does it seem see sweeter sounding lately?
Sounds a bit like Nat King Cole Scramblin' for change to pay the toll
This back to the sea love has lasted longer than we did expect.
Now the D, the work that we must do is, the work that we must do is, it's never done.
I mean, there's another couple of verses.
